page.title: 14Shouldham-A day at school.3
page.content: At playtime,during the last few weeks the Infants have enjoyed playing with the fallen leaves from the sycamore trees.A whistle is blown at the end of play and we have to stand still,then we line up and come in. From end of play to lunch time we do some kind of English. During the week we do spellings,news,dictionary work, story,poetry and reading skills.In news we write home and world news.This week many wrote about the Prince and Princess of Wales visiting Australia and America.Someone wrote about an old lady who had her 101st birthday in a home at Swaffham and another person wrote about the volcano erupting in Columbia.If we do not finish we have to do it at home and hand it in on Friday. At midday we stop for lunch. Mr. Caley brings our lunch from Marham Airfield School.
